adventure_overview: Astronomy is the focus of this Adventure as Tigers explore the night sky and discover constellations. Prior to any activity, use Scouting America SAFE Checklist to ensure the safety of all those involved. All participants in official Scouting America activities should become familiar with the Guide to Safe Scouting and applicable program literature or manuals.

requirements.text: Observe the night sky with your den or Tiger adult partner. Talk about the items you see or might see there.

activities.name: Night Sky Scavenger Hunt
activities.description: Conduct a scavenger hunt  of  what is in the night sky.

requirements.text: Look at distant objects through a telescope, binoculars, or camera. Show how to focus the device you choose.

activities.name: I Can See the Stars
activities.description: The basics of how to use a telescope.

requirements.text: ObserveÂ  in the sky or select from a book, chart, computer, or electronic device two constellations that are easy to see in the night sky. With your den or Tiger adult partner, find out the constellation name and how to identify them. Create a picture of one of the constellations.

activities.name: Pictures in the Sky
activities.description: Identify  and  observe  two constellations in the night sky.

requirements.text: Create a homemade model of a constellation.

activities.name: Can-stellation
activities.description: Make a model constellation out of a tin can.

activities.name: Edible Constellation
activities.description: Make an edible model of a constellation.

activities.name: Glowing Constellation
activities.description: Glow in the dark painting of constellations.
